catalog_info.title: Discrete Mathematics
catalog_info.notes: Covers material used in Computer Science 121 and Computer Science 124.
catalog_info.prereq: Not to be taken in addition to Computer Science 20, Mathematics 55 or Mathematics 122.
catalog_info.description: An introduction to sets, logic, finite groups, finite fields, finite geometry, finite topology, combinatorics and graph theory.  A recurring theme of the course is the symmetry group of the regular icosahedron.  Elementary category theory will be introduced as a unifying principle.  Taught in a seminar format: students will gain experience in presenting proofs at the blackboard.
